column1: Gently Musai plucked out the arrow and helped the bird to rise
column2: pushing back the undergrowth so that its broad white pinions could have free play. After a few feeble attempts to fly it spread its wings
column4: and after circling several times round its benefactor as though to thank him
column5: it flew off to the mountain.Musai went back to his work
column6: hoping that in season his labor would yield a good crop. He had his widowed mother to support and must needs toil every day. His one delight was to come home
column7: weary after the long hours of labour in the muddy rice field
column8: and have a hot bath. This his mother always had ready for him. Then
column9: clean and with a fresh kimono
column10: and a little rest before supper-time
column11: he was ready for a quiet evening with the neighbours.
